member.name: T:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData
member.summary: Information about the glyph extracted from an image using .

member.name: F:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.Quadrilateral
member.summary: Quadrilateral of the raw glyph detected (see ). First point of this quadrilateral corresponds to upper-left point of the raw glyph data.

member.name: F:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.RawData
member.summary: Raw glyph data extacted from processed image.

member.name: F:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.Confidence
member.summary: Confidence level of recognition, [0.5, 0.1].

remarks.para: The confidence level is a reflection of how property is reliable. If it equals to 1.0, then (and ) is 100% sure about the glyph data found. But if it getting closer to 0.5, then recognizer is uncertain about one or more values of the raw glyph's data, which affect uncertainty level of the entire glyph.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{AForge.IntPoint},System.Byte[0:,0:],System.Single)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Quadrilateral of the raw glyph detected.
Raw glyph data extacted from processed image.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.Clone
member.summary: Clone the object by making its exact copy.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.RecognizedGlyph
member.summary: Recognized glyph from a .

remarks.para: This property is set by in the case if matches (see ) to any of the glyphs in the specified glyphs' database (see . If a match is found then this property is set to the matching glyph. Otherwise it is set to .

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.RecognizedQuadrilateral
member.summary: Quadrilateral area corresponding to the .

remarks.para: First point of this quadrilateral corresponds to upper-left point of the recognized glyph, not the raw extracted glyph. This property may not be equal to since the raw glyph data may represent rotation of the glyph registered in glyphs' database.
This property is really important for applications like augmented reality, where it is required to know coordinates of points corresponding to each corner of the recognized glyph.
This property is always set together with on successful glyph matching. Otherwise it is set to .

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.TransformationMatrix
member.summary: Glyphs transformation matrix.

remarks.para: The property provides real world glyph's transformation, which is estimated by glyph tracking routine.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData.IsTransformationDetected
member.summary: Check if glyph pose was estimated or not.

remarks.para: The property tells if property was calculated for this glyph or not.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Clone the glyph.

para.note: It is user's responsibility to clone property if it is set to reference type object.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.CheckForMatching(System.Byte[0:,0:])
member.summary: Check for matching between the glyph and specified raw glyph data.
member.param: Glyph data to check match with.
member.exception: Invalid glyph data array - must be square.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.CheckForMatching(System.Byte[0:,0:],System.Byte[0:,0:])
member.summary: Check for matching between raw data of two glyphs.
member.param: Target glyph data to match with.
member.exception: Invalid glyph data array - must be square.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.CheckIfRotationInvariant(System.Byte[0:,0:])
member.summary: Check if the specified glyph data are rotation invariant or not.
member.param: Glyph data to check for rotation invariance.
member.returns: Returns if the specified glyph data are rotation invariant or otherwise.

remarks.para: Rotation invariant glyph means that it looks the same in case if rotated by 90 or 180 degrees. In most applications (like augmented reality) glyphs must be rotation variant, so it could be possible to recognize rotation of the glyph. But for some applications, where glyph are not supposed to be rotated, the rotation invariance is also acceptable.

member.exception: Invalid glyph data array - must be square.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.CheckIfEveryRowColumnHasValue(System.Byte[0:,0:])
member.summary: Check if the specified raw glyph's data has a value in each inner row/column.
member.returns: Returns if the specified glyph data contain a value (elemenent equal to 1) in every inner row/column or otherwise.

remarks.para: The tool method is used to check if specified glyph data have at least single element equal to 1 in every row/column except the first and the last.

member.exception: Invalid glyph data array - must be square.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.CheckIfGlyphHasBorder(System.Byte[0:,0:])
member.summary: Check if the specified raw glyph's data have a border of 0 elements.
member.returns: Returns if the specified glyph data contain 0 elements only in the first and the last row and column or otherwise.
member.exception: Invalid glyph data array - must be square.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.Name
member.summary: Glyph's name.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.Size
member.summary: Glyph's size - length of array dimenstions.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.Data
member.summary: Glyph's data array.

remarks.para: The array contains 0 and 1 elements, where 0 corresponds to black areas of the glyph and 1 corresponds to white areas.

para.note: The data array must be square.

member.exception: The data array cannot be null.
Both dimensions of the array must have the same length.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph.UserData
member.summary: User's data associated with the glyph.

remarks.para: The property allows to associate any user data with the glyph, like glyph's visualization parameters for example.

member.summary: Remove a glyph from the database.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphDatabase.Replace(System.String,AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.Glyph)
member.summary: Replace a glyph in the databse.
member.param: Name of the glyph to replace.
New glyph to put into the database.

remarks.para: If the specified glyph's equals to the name of the new glyph, then the database is just updated with the new glyph. But if these names are different, then the old glyph with the specified name is removed from the database and the new glyph is added.

member.exception: A glyph with the specified does not exist in the database.

member.summary: Rename a glyph in the database.
member.param: Name of the glyph to rename.
New name of the glyph to set.
member.exception: A glyph with the specified does not exist in the database.

member.summary: Get collection of glyph names available in the database.
member.returns: Returns read only collection of glyph names.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphDatabase.RecognizeGlyph(System.Byte[0:,0:],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Recognize the glyph represented by the specified raw glyph's data.
member.param: Contains rotation angle of the match on success (0, 90, 180 or 270) - see . In the case of no matching is found the value is assigned to -1.
member.returns: Returns a glyph from the database which matches the specified raw glyph data. If there is no matching found, then is returned.

remarks.para: The method searches for a glyph in the database which matches (see ) the specified raw glyph data.

member.summary: Size of glyphs in the dabase.

remarks.para: All glyph of a database are sizexsize square glyph.

member.summary: Number of glyphs in the database.

member.param: Name of the glyph to retrieve for the database.

member.name: T:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphRecognizer
member.summary: The class locates and recognizes glyphs in a specified image.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphRecognizer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Size of glyphs to search for and recognize.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphRecognizer.#ctor(AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphDatabase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphRecognizer.FindGlyphs(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Search for glyphs in the specified image and recognize them.
member.returns: Return a list of found glyphs.

remarks.para: The method does processing of the specified image and searches for glyphs in it of the specified size. In the case if glyphs' database is set, it tries to find a matching glyph in it for each found glyph in the image. If matching is found, then RecognizedGlyph and RecognizedQuadrilateral properties of are set correspondingly.

member.exception: Pixel format of the specified image is not supported. It must be 8 bpp indexed or 24/32 bpp color image.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphRecognizer.FindGlyphs(AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage)
member.summary: Search for glyphs in the specified image and recognize them.
member.returns: Return a list of found glyphs.

remarks.para: The method does processing of the specified image and searches for glyphs in it of the specified size. In the case if glyphs' database is set, it tries to find a matching glyph in it for each found glyph in the image. If matching is found, then RecognizedGlyph and RecognizedQuadrilateral properties of are set correspondingly.

member.exception: Pixel format of the specified image is not supported. It must be 8 bpp indexed or 24/32 bpp color image.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphRecognizer.GlyphSize
member.summary: Size of glyph to search and recognize, [5, 23].

remarks.para: The property specifies the size of glyphs the instance of the class will be searching for.

para.note: Setting of this property is allowed only in the case if is set to . If glyph database is set, then this property is initialized with glyphs' size of the database.

member.exception: Glyph size cannot be set if glyph database is set.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphRecognizer.GlyphDatabase
member.summary: Database of glyphs to recognize.

remarks.para: The property sets database of glyphs, which could be recognized by an instance of the class. In the case if glyph recognizer finds some glyphs which are not listed in the database, it will still provide information about them, but RecognizedGlyph and RecognizedQuadrilateral properties of will not be set.
Setting this property will also set automatically to the glyphs' size specified in the database.

para.note: If the property is set to , the class will only do searching for glyphs - objects which look like a glyph and satisfy certain constaints applicable to a valid glyph. In this case it will provide information about all found glyphs - their position and raw data.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphRecognizer.MaxNumberOfGlyphsToSearch
member.summary: Maximum number of glyph to search for in a single image, [1, 10].

remarks.para: The property sets maximum number of glyphs to search in a given image. If image processing routines finds the specified number of glyphs it will stop further image processing even if there are some more data to process is available.

para.note: The image processing routine analyzes found objects in size descending order - larger objects are analyzed first.

remarks.para: Default value is set to 3.

member.name: T:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphTracker
member.summary: Glyph tracker.

remarks.para: The purpose of this class is to perform tracking of glyphs, which are typically recognized by routine or similar. The main purpose of this class is to provide 3D pose estimation of glyphs as well as provide glyphs' IDs, which could be used by user to perform glyphs' tracking in continuous video feed. See method for additional information.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphTracker.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphTracker.TrackGlyphs(System.Collections.Generic.List{AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.ExtractedGlyphData})
member.summary: Track glyphs in continuous video feed.
member.returns: Return IDs of the specified glyphs

remarks.para: The method perform tracking of glyphs in continuous video feed. The specified list of is supposed to be collected using or similar method.

The main purpose of the method is to perform glyphs’ 3D pose estimation and reduce glyphs’ vibration (if glyph's corners do small negligible movement between continuous frames (kind of shacking), then it is treated as noise and glyphs pose is taken from the history). The estimated pose is provided as and the property is set in this case as well. If movement noise suppression is performed, then property is updated with coordinates from previous frame (which means noise suppression is performed for recognized glyphs only).

As an extra bonus the method provides list of glyphs' IDs - each detected glyph gets an ID so it could be tracked between continuous video frames. Note: these IDs should not be considered 100% reliable as ID of the same glyph may change if it disappears for a while or does not move smoothly.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphTracker.Reset
member.summary: Reset internal state of the tracker.

remarks.para: The method resets all internal variables of the tracker to the initial state so it is ready to be used on different video feed.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphTracker.ImageSize
member.summary: Size of the image containing glyphs.

remarks.para: The property sets size of the image from which tracked glyphs are extracted.
Default value is set to (640, 480).

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphTracker.CameraFocalLength
member.summary: Effective focal length of camera.

remarks.para: The property sets effective focal length of the camera used to capture glyphs being tracked.

para.note: In many cases the value can be set to width of the image containing glyphs to achieve reasonable results. However the property is provided to let user make decision about it.

remarks.para: Default value is set to 640.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.GlyphTracker.GlyphSize
member.summary: Real size of tracked glyphs.

remarks.para: The property sets real size of glyphs being tracked. The class makes assumption that glyphs are square objects, so specifying size of one glyph's side is enough.
It is up to user to choose units for this property. Just keep in mind that glyph's translation which is part of glyph's transformation matrix will have same units.
If the property is set to 0, then glyphs' pose estimation will not be performed.
Default value is set to 0. The property can not be negative.

member.name: T:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.SquareBinaryGlyphRecognizer
member.summary: Recognition of square glyphs in binary images.

remarks.para: The class performs processing of binary images trying to recognize square glyph of the specified size.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.SquareBinaryGlyphRecognizer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.SquareBinaryGlyphRecognizer.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.SquareBinaryGlyphRecognizer.Recognize(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Single@)
member.summary: Recognize glyph in the specified image.
member.param: Rectangle of the glyph to recognize.
member.returns: Returns recognized glyph's data - 2D array of x.

remarks.para: Performs processing of the specified image recognizing a glyph in it and providing confidence level of recognition. If the confidence level equals to 1.0, then this routine is 100% confident about the recognized glyph. If the confidence level is getting closer to 0.5, then it means that some glyph's values are not reliable enough – kind of 50/50: certain glyph’s rectangle may not be white enough or may not be black enough.

member.exception: Pixel format of the specified image is not supported. Must be 8 bpp indexed image.

member.name: M:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.SquareBinaryGlyphRecognizer.Recognize(AForge.Imaging.UnmanagedImage,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Single@)
member.summary: Recognize glyph in the specified image.
member.param: Rectangle of the glyph to recognize.
member.returns: Returns recognized glyph's data - 2D array of x.

remarks.para: Performs processing of the specified image recognizing a glyph in it and providing confidence level of recognition. If the confidence level equals to 1.0, then this routine is 100% confident about the recognized glyph. If the confidence level is getting closer to 0.5, then it means that some glyph's values are not reliable enough – kind of 50/50: certain glyph’s rectangle may not be white enough or may not be black enough.

member.exception: Pixel format of the specified image is not supported. Must be 8 bpp indexed image.

member.name: P:AForge.Vision.GlyphRecognition.SquareBinaryGlyphRecognizer.GlyphSize
member.summary: Glyph size to recognize, [5, 23].

remarks.para: The property sets glyphs' size to recognize in given images.
Default value is set to 5.
